data.name: para
data.content: Scientific notation is a way of writing very large or very small numbers in a compact and simple form.

data.name: para
data.content: In standard form, a number is written as: a × 10^n, where 1 ≤ a < 10 and n is an integer.

data.name: bullet
data.content: Move decimal point to make a number between 1 and 10.

data.name: bullet
data.content: Count how many places the decimal moves.

data.name: bullet
data.content: Write that count as power of 10.

data.name: para
data.content: 3000000 = 3 × 10^6. The decimal moves 6 places to the left, so the power of 10 is +6.

data.name: para
data.content: 0.00045 = 4.5 × 10^-4. The decimal moves 4 places to the right, so the power of 10 is −4.

data.name: bullet
data.content: Large numbers have positive powers of 10.

data.name: bullet
data.content: Small numbers have negative powers of 10.
